column5: Nice smallies for sure!!!!!!!! cheers,well done
OK, I can't hold out any longer with the real answer.  The fish obviously weighs 1.4 times the weight of the bottle.  1.4 liters x 2.2 lbs / liter = 3.08 lbs.
Your answer would be much more credible (it would hold more water) had you spelled 'litre' correctly.
Acually it can be spelt both ways in the english language, so we will let this go this time seeing your from Que. lol

Picked it up jigging a shoal in about 15 FOW. Got half a dozen more, this being the biggest. All in the 12-16 inch range. What a honey hole!!!...This is the third time getting out to it and still have never seen a boat within atleast half a KM. What do you guys think it weighed ??       This is a 1 LITRE bottle !!!
'bout 3lbs?
i know that bottle, thats a BIG smallie. I would guesstimate its weight at around 5lbs!
I agree with Barnie...I had an 18" smallie that looked similar in girth that came in just over 2.5 pounds.
Sorry, but not even close - 2.5 to 3 max.  I would like you as a fishing partner though....lol.
Ya, looks to be around 3ish. Nice fish though!
This is a 1 LITRE bottle !!!   That's a 1.5 litre bottle, no?
Is that dad's old Pricecraft? Now that was a heavy? Swing by the house and get a scale   Nice catch . . .
Good 'ol San Benedetto!! LOL.  Nice fish. I agree - prob pushing around 3lbs+
Had to brag.  Here is my lunker from this weekend.
Not sure about the weight, but it sure is bigger than the smallies that I've caught so far!
nice fish.
I weighed a 19" smallie last year with about the same girth and it weighed 3.3lbs. Nice fish by any standards.
It's pretty fat, I'd say an honest 3 lber.  Nice fish.  Charles
i dont know guys ....got a 4.3 lber last week and it was just under 20 and very fat.....that fish looks close to 4
4 - 4.5lbs definately
3 - 3.3 definitely LOL maybe high at that. nice fish though.
Well I'm glad we got that cleared up.
hahahaha  I would say that it weighs over a pound, but less than 10.
How much more did you weigh AFTER dinner?
Beauty fish no matter what the weight. Congrats.
19 inches, definitely 3, likely under 3.5 .

WOW!!!! That's a real nice bottle.  I'm not looking for GPS points or anything but just some tips.  Did you get it at a grocery store? Variety Store?  Did you pay cash, debit, or credit?  Is it recyclable?  Could I get one like that within 2 hours of the GTA?  Thanks in advance for any details you can provide.
i caught a 20 inch on nipissing a couple weeks ago and it weighed 3lbs  nice fish anyway
I'd say it weighs about a litre. Maybe a litre and a half.
